meanings.definition: A model or replica of a machine or structure for instructional or experimental purposes.
meanings.sent1: The students built a mockup of a volcano for their science project.
meanings.sent2: The engineers created a mockup of the new bridge design to test its stability.
meanings.sent3: The mockup of the robot made everyone laugh with its oversized head.
meanings.sent4: Her mockup of the solar system was so detailed, it looked like the real thing.
meanings.sent5: The mockup of the car was so accurate that it fooled many people at first glance.

meanings.definition: A full-sized model of a design or device used for testing or demonstration.
meanings.sent1: The company built a mockup of the new phone to showcase its features.
meanings.sent2: The mockup of the airplane interior allowed passengers to see the layout before boarding.
meanings.sent3: The mockup of the house was so big that it barely fit through the door.
meanings.sent4: His mockup of the roller coaster was so realistic, it felt like you were actually riding it.
meanings.sent5: The mockup of the boat was so detailed that it even had tiny oars and life jackets.

meanings.definition: A preliminary version of a product or design used for visualization or feedback.
meanings.sent1: The designer presented a mockup of the website layout to the client.
meanings.sent2: The mockup of the packaging helped the team decide on the final design.
meanings.sent3: The mockup of the dress made the mannequin look like a fashion model.
meanings.sent4: His mockup of the app interface was like a blueprint for the developers.
meanings.sent5: The mockup of the logo was so eye-catching that it immediately caught everyone's attention.
